title: (x) Where to buy Lagarto - Kimera Type Foundry {Stephen}
content:
Greetings.

Does anyone know if this typeface has been made commercially available?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122455im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lagartobig_5635.gif)

 [‹ i know it's french, but what font is it?](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122455/http:/typophile.com/node/32018 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) matchtennispartner.nl website logo - Linotype Atlantis {Mikey D} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122455/http:/typophile.com/node/32004 "Go to next forum topic")
author: malbright

comments.content: [Legarto](http://web.archive.org/) is a custom font by [Gabriel Martinez Meave](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122455/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gabriel%252BMartinez%252BMeave) and not commercially available.
I take that back. It looks like his [new site](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122455/http:/www.kimeratype.com/) shows it available via bank transfer and his stuff will be on MyFonts soon.

And aren’t the prices very reasonable? With average prices south of a hundred dollars, I’m heading south of the board for my next font purchases!

Also check out Artifex and Integra- the Optimas of Mexico? I think so!

Scrumptious stuff there. Thank you for posting. I saw this too at the Porchez type blog and I’m glad to know its available now.

Mike Diaz :o)
